tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the contents of a file with error handling.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: The path to the file to be read.

returns.description: The content of the file or an error message.

tools.code: def read_file(file_path, encoding='utf-8'): try: with open(file_path, 'r', encoding=encoding) as file: return file.read() except Exception as e: return f'Error reading file: {str(e)}'

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Write content to a file, creating it if necessary.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: The path to the file to write.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content to write to the file.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The mode to open the file in ('w' to overwrite, 'a' to append).

returns.description: A success message or an error message.

tools.code: def write_file(file_path, content, mode='w', encoding='utf-8'): try: with open(file_path, mode, encoding=encoding) as file: file.write(content) return 'File written successfully' except Exception as e: return f'Error writing file: {str(e)}'

tools.name: execute_python
tools.description: Execute a Python script and capture its output.

returns.description: The output of the executed code or an error message.

tools.code: def execute_python(code): import subprocess try: result = subprocess.run(['python', '-c', code], capture_output=True, text=True) return result.stdout if result.returncode == 0 else result.stderr except Exception as e: return f'Error executing Python code: {str(e)}'
